DOCNAME: CASE OF JOSEF FISCHER v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - finding of violation sufficient;Costs and expenses (domestic proceedings) - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG ( PERSON für PERSON ) convicted the applicant , inter alia , under LAW ) , on numerous counts of handling stolen goods ( Hehlerei ) and sentenced him to CARDINAL GPE imprisonment . ORG found that the applicant , who dealt with antiques , had bought , DATE , antiques which had been stolen in the north of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a plea of nullity and an appeal against sentence with ORG ( Oberster Gerichtshof ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Procurator General ( Generalprokurator ) submitted the following comments on the applicant ’s plea of nullity :
" In the view of the Procurator General , the plea of nullity of the accused PERSON can be dealt with under LAW of LAW . The transmission of a decision is requested . "

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s plea of nullity and , as regards the appeal against sentence , referred the case to ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .

CARDINAL . Under LAW ( d ) LAW ) , a plea of nullity may be rejected by ORG after deliberations in private if ORG unanimously finds that the complaint should be dismissed as manifestly ill - founded without any need for further deliberation .
CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL § CARDINAL of LAW , as in force at the relevant time , reads as follows :

" If the public prosecutor at an appellate court submits observations on an appeal on grounds of nullity ... , the appellate court shall communicate those observations to the accused ( person concerned ) , advising him that he may submit comments on them within a reasonable period of time that it shall determine . Such communication may be dispensed with if the prosecutor confines himself to opposing the appeal without adducing any argument , if he merely supports the accused or if the accused ’s appeal is upheld . "
CARDINAL . NORP Since the CARDINAL LAW ( Strafrechtsänderungsgesetz ) the last sentence of LAW § CARDINAL reads as follows :
“ Such communication may be dispensed with if the prosecutor merely supports the accused or if the accused ’s appeal is upheld . "
